meanings.definition: The shedding of the outer layers of skin.
meanings.sent1: After a sunburn, desquamation of the skin can occur.
meanings.sent2: Proper hydration can help prevent excessive desquamation.
meanings.sent3: The lizard's desquamation was so extreme, it left a trail of scales behind.
meanings.sent4: The desquamation of old paint revealed the vibrant colors underneath.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained desquamation as the skin's way of renewing itself.

meanings.definition: The process of peeling or scaling off.
meanings.sent1: During winter, desquamation of dry skin is common.
meanings.sent2: The desquamation of the bark revealed the tree's true age.
meanings.sent3: The desquamation of the onion's layers made it easier to chop.
meanings.sent4: The desquamation of the old wallpaper exposed the cracks in the wall.
meanings.sent5: The artist used desquamation as a metaphor for shedding past experiences.
